description.content:
Last Updated July 2025

You can use Oracle REST APIs to view and manage data stored in Oracle Supply Chain Management Cloud.

Whether you're experienced with or new to REST, use this guide to find what you need, including:

  • A quick start that walks you through a simple request example.
  • Detailed descriptions for each REST API resource.

item.name: Get all work center resource exceptions

request.name: Get all work center resource exceptions

description.content: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AssociatedShiftId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the shift that the exception will be applied to. This value is optional.
  • AssociatedShiftName; string; User-supplied name that identifies the shift that the exception will be applied to. It is used if the AssociatedShiftId is not provided in the request.
  • CreatedBy; string; User who created the record.
  • CreationDate; string; Date and time when the user created the record.
  • EndDate; string; Date when the work center resource exception ends. This value is optional and defaults to the start date if it's not supplied. The value must be in the ISO8601 format such as "YYYY-MM-DD".
  • ExceptionDuration; number; Duration in Hours for the work center resource exception. This value is required.
  • ExceptionEndTime; string; Time when the work center resource exception ends. It is derived from the start time and duration, and is not input.
  • ExceptionEndTimeInMs; integer; Time in microseconds from midnight when the work center resource exception ends.
  • ExceptionStartTime; string; Time when the work center resource exception starts. This value is required. It must be formatted as "HH:MM AM|PM".
  • ExceptionStartTimeInMs; integer; Time in microseconds from midnight when the work center resource exception starts.
  • LastUpdateDate; string; Date and time when the user most recently updated the record.
  • LastUpdatedBy; string; User who most recently updated the record.
  • OrganizationCode; string; User-supplied short code that uniquely identifies the organization. It is used if the OrganizationId attribute is not provided in the request.
  • OrganizationId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the inventory organization that's the plant.
  • OrganizationName; string; User-supplied name that identifies the organization. It is used if neither the OrganizationId nor the OrganizationCode attributes are provided in the request.
  • ScheduleId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the schedule that the organization references as the manufacturing or production calendar. It corresponds to the Manufacturing Calendar specified in the Manage Plant Parameters task for the inventory organization in the request.
  • ScheduleName; string; User-supplied name that identifies the schedule that the organization references as the manufacturing calendar. It is used if the ScheduleId is not provided in the request.
  • StartDate; string; Date when the work center resource exception starts. This value is required. The value must be in the ISO8601 format such as "YYYY-MM-DD".
  • WorkCenterResourceExceptionId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the work center resource exception in the production calendar of a plant. The application generates this value when it creates the exception.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • PrimaryKey: Finds work center resource exceptions according to the exception ID as the primary key.
    Finder Variables:
    • WorkCenterResourceExceptionId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the work center resource exception in the production calendar of a plant. The application generates the value when it creates the exception.
The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

response.name: The following table describes the default response for this task.

  • OrganizationCode; string; User-supplied short code that uniquely identifies the organization. It is used if the OrganizationId attribute is not provided in the request.
  • OrganizationId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the inventory organization that's the plant.
  • OrganizationName; string; User-supplied name that identifies the organization. It is used if neither the OrganizationId nor the OrganizationCode attributes are provided in the request.
  • ScheduleId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the schedule that the organization references as the manufacturing or production calendar. It corresponds to the Manufacturing Calendar specified in the Manage Plant Parameters task for the inventory organization in the request.
  • ScheduleName; string; User-supplied name that identifies the schedule that the organization references as the manufacturing calendar. It is used if the ScheduleId is not provided in the request.
  • StartDate; string; Date when the work center resource exception starts. This value is required. The value must be in the ISO8601 format such as "YYYY-MM-DD".

The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

item.name: Create one work center resource exception

request.name: Create one work center resource exception

description.content: Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, the server performs an Upsert operation instead of a Create operation. During an Upsert operation, the server attempts to find an existing resource that matches the payload. If a match is found, the server updates the existing resource instead of creating a new one. If not found or false (default), the server performs a Create operation. Note that the Upsert operation isn't supported for date-effective REST resources.
The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

response.name: The following table describes the default response for this task.

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

Example:

More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

Example:

This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AvailabilityOverride; number; Override quantity value. It replaces the default units available for a given resource for the time interval defined by the exception. This value is required.
  • CreatedBy; string; User who created the record.
  • CreationDate; string; Date and time when the user created the record.
  • DefaultAvailability; integer; Value of the resource availability.
  • LastUpdateDate; string; Date and time when the user most recently updated the record.
  • LastUpdatedBy; string; User who most recently updated the record.
  • ResourceId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the resource being updated. This value is required.
  • ResourceName; string; Name that uniquely identifies the resource. It is used if the ResourceId is not provided in the request.
  • WorkCenterCode; string; User-supplied value that uniquely identifies the work center associated to the resource. It is used if the WorkCenterId is not provided in the request.
  • WorkCenterId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the work center associated to the resource. This value is required.
  • WorkCenterName; string; Name that uniquely identifies the work center. It is used if the WorkCenterCode is not provided in the request.
  • WorkCenterResourceExceptionDetailId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the resource availability override. The application generates this value when it creates the exception for the resource.
  • WorkCenterResourceExceptionId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the work center resource exception in the production calendar of a plant. The application generates this value when it creates the exception.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • PrimaryKey: Finds resource availability overrides according to the exception detail ID as the primary key.
    Finder Variables:
    • WorkCenterResourceExceptionDetailId; integer; The value that uniquely identifies the resource availability override. The application generates the value when it creates the exception for the resource.
(Required) Value that uniquely identifies the work center resource exception in the production calendar of a plant. The application generates this value when it creates the exception.
The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

  • WorkCenterId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the work center associated to the resource. This value is required.
  • WorkCenterName; string; Name that uniquely identifies the work center. It is used if the WorkCenterCode is not provided in the request.
  • WorkCenterResourceExceptionDetailId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the resource availability override. The application generates this value when it creates the exception for the resource.
  • WorkCenterResourceExceptionId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the work center resource exception in the production calendar of a plant. The application generates this value when it creates the exception.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • PrimaryKey: Finds resource availability overrides according to the exception detail ID as the primary key.
    Finder Variables:
    • WorkCenterResourceExceptionDetailId; integer; The value that uniquely identifies the resource availability override. The application generates the value when it creates the exception for the resource.
The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".
(Required) Value that uniquely identifies the work center resource exception in the production calendar of a plant. The application generates this value when it creates the exception.

Contains one of the following values: true or false. If true, the server performs an Upsert operation instead of a Create operation. During an Upsert operation, the server attempts to find an existing resource that matches the payload. If a match is found, the server updates the existing resource instead of creating a new one. If not found or false (default), the server performs a Create operation. Note that the Upsert operation isn't supported for date-effective REST resources.

When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical

item.name: Generate the calendar data to display for a single work center resource in the Work Center Resource Calendar task.

request.name: Generate the calendar data to display for a single work center resource in the Work Center Resource Calendar task.

description.content: Generate the calendar data for a specified date range for the specified work center resource. The calendar information shows the active shifts and available units, as well as known shift and resource exceptions which alter standard working time. This action is intended for use in Fusion Cloud Manufacturing or Maintenance when viewing resource availability.
